findings.title: Unsecured approve function
findings.description: The approve function is unsecured, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of allowances.

findings.title: Unsecured transfer function
findings.description: The 'transfer' function allows unsecured token transfers to a specified address.

findings.title: Unsecured transferFrom function
findings.description: The approve function allows a spender to withdraw a set number of tokens from a specified account without proper validation, leading to unauthorized token transfers.

findings.title: Unsecured permit function
findings.description: The permit function does not have sufficient security measures to prevent unauthorized access.

findings.title: Unsecured mint function
findings.description: The mint function is unsecured, allowing unauthorized users to mint new tokens.

findings.title: Unsecured burn function
findings.description: The burn function allows executing transfers of contract tokens to burn or dead address without proper security measures.

findings.title: Unsecured swap function
findings.description: The swap functions (swapExactTokensForTokens, swapTokensForExactTokens, swapExactETHForTokens, swapTokensForExactETH, swapExactTokensForETH, swapETHForExactTokens) do not have any access control or validation, allowing anyone to call them and potentially drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Unsecured skim function
findings.description: The skim function is unsecured and can be exploited.

findings.title: Unsecured initialize function
findings.description: The initialize function is unsecured and can be called by anyone.
